Register.name: PSELRESET[0]
Register.description: Description collection[0]: Mapping of the nRESET function

BitField.name: PIN
BitField.description: Pin number of PORT onto which nRESET is exposed

BitField.name: PORT
BitField.description: Port number onto which nRESET is exposed

Register.name: PSELRESET[1]
Register.description: Description collection[0]: Mapping of the nRESET function

BitField.name: PIN
BitField.description: Pin number of PORT onto which nRESET is exposed

BitField.name: PORT
BitField.description: Port number onto which nRESET is exposed

BitField.name: PALL
BitField.description: Enable or disable access port protection.

Register.name: NFCPINS
Register.description: Setting of pins dedicated to NFC functionality: NFC antenna or GPIO

BitField.name: PROTECT
BitField.description: Setting of pins dedicated to NFC functionality

Enum.name: Disabled
Enum.description: Operation as GPIO pins. Same protection as normal GPIO pins

Enum.name: NFC
Enum.description: Operation as NFC antenna pins. Configures the protection for NFC operation

BitField.name: CPUNIDEN
BitField.description: Configure CPU non-intrusive debug features

Enum.name: Enabled
Enum.description: Enable CPU ITM and ETM functionality (default behavior)

Enum.name: Disabled
Enum.description: Disable CPU ITM and ETM functionality

BitField.name: CPUFPBEN
BitField.description: Configure CPU flash patch and breakpoint (FPB) unit behavior

Enum.name: Disabled
Enum.description: Disable CPU FPB unit. Writes into the FPB registers will be ignored.

Register.name: EXTSUPPLY
Register.description: Enable external circuitry to be supplied from VDD pin. Applicable in high voltage mode only.

BitField.name: EXTSUPPLY
BitField.description: Enable external circuitry to be supplied from VDD pin (output of REG0 stage)

Enum.name: Disabled
Enum.description: No current can be drawn from the VDD pin

Enum.name: Enabled
Enum.description: It is allowed to supply external circuitry from the VDD pin

Register.name: REGOUT0
Register.description: GPIO reference voltage / external output supply voltage in high voltage mode

BitField.name: VOUT
BitField.description: Output voltage from of REG0 regulator stage. The maximum output voltage from this stage is given as VDDH - VEXDIF.

BitField.name: POFWARN
BitField.description: Write '1' to Enable interrupt for POFWARN event

BitField.name: SLEEPENTER
BitField.description: Write '1' to Enable interrupt for SLEEPENTER event

BitField.name: SLEEPEXIT
BitField.description: Write '1' to Enable interrupt for SLEEPEXIT event

BitField.name: USBDETECTED
BitField.description: Write '1' to Enable interrupt for USBDETECTED event

BitField.name: USBREMOVED
BitField.description: Write '1' to Enable interrupt for USBREMOVED event

BitField.name: USBPWRRDY
BitField.description: Write '1' to Enable interrupt for USBPWRRDY event

BitField.name: POFWARN
BitField.description: Write '1' to Disable interrupt for POFWARN event

BitField.name: SLEEPENTER
BitField.description: Write '1' to Disable interrupt for SLEEPENTER event

BitField.name: SLEEPEXIT
BitField.description: Write '1' to Disable interrupt for SLEEPEXIT event

BitField.name: USBDETECTED
BitField.description: Write '1' to Disable interrupt for USBDETECTED event

BitField.name: USBREMOVED
BitField.description: Write '1' to Disable interrupt for USBREMOVED event

BitField.name: USBPWRRDY
BitField.description: Write '1' to Disable interrupt for USBPWRRDY event

BitField.name: RESETPIN
BitField.description: Reset from pin-reset detected

BitField.name: DOG
BitField.description: Reset from watchdog detected

BitField.name: SREQ
BitField.description: Reset from soft reset detected

BitField.name: LOCKUP
BitField.description: Reset from CPU lock-up detected

BitField.name: OFF
BitField.description: Reset due to wake up from System OFF mode when wakeup is triggered from DETECT signal from GPIO

BitField.name: LPCOMP
BitField.description: Reset due to wake up from System OFF mode when wakeup is triggered from ANADETECT signal from LPCOMP

BitField.name: DIF
BitField.description: Reset due to wake up from System OFF mode when wakeup is triggered from entering into debug interface mode

BitField.name: NFC
BitField.description: Reset due to wake up from System OFF mode by NFC field detect

BitField.name: VBUS
BitField.description: Reset due to wake up from System OFF mode by Vbus rising into valid range

BitField.name: RAMBLOCK0
BitField.description: RAM block 0 is on or off/powering up

BitField.name: RAMBLOCK1
BitField.description: RAM block 1 is on or off/powering up

BitField.name: RAMBLOCK2
BitField.description: RAM block 2 is on or off/powering up

BitField.name: RAMBLOCK3
BitField.description: RAM block 3 is on or off/powering up

BitField.name: VBUSDETECT
BitField.description: VBUS input detection status (USBDETECTED and USBREMOVED events are derived from this information)

BitField.name: OUTPUTRDY
BitField.description: USB supply output settling time elapsed

Enum.name: NotReady
Enum.description: USBREG output settling time not elapsed

Enum.name: Ready
Enum.description: USBREG output settling time elapsed (same information as USBPWRRDY event)

BitField.name: SYSTEMOFF
BitField.description: Enable System OFF mode

BitField.name: POF
BitField.description: Enable or disable power failure comparator

BitField.name: THRESHOLD
BitField.description: Power failure comparator threshold setting. This setting applies both for normal voltage mode (supply connected to both VDD and VDDH) and high voltage mode (supply connected to VDDH only).

BitField.name: THRESHOLDVDDH
BitField.description: Power failure comparator threshold setting for high voltage mode (supply connected to VDDH only). This setting does not apply for normal voltage mode (supply connected to both VDD and VDDH).

BitField.name: GPREGRET
BitField.description: General purpose retention register

BitField.name: GPREGRET
BitField.description: General purpose retention register

Register.name: DCDCEN
Register.description: Enable DC/DC converter for REG1 stage.

BitField.name: DCDCEN
BitField.description: Enable DC/DC converter for REG1 stage.

Register.name: DCDCEN0
Register.description: Enable DC/DC converter for REG0 stage.

BitField.name: DCDCEN
BitField.description: Enable DC/DC converter for REG0 stage.

BitField.name: MAINREGSTATUS
BitField.description: Main supply status

Enum.name: Normal
Enum.description: Normal voltage mode. Voltage supplied on VDD.

Enum.name: High
Enum.description: High voltage mode. Voltage supplied on VDDH.

Register.name: HFXODEBOUNCE

BitField.name: HFXODEBOUNCE
BitField.description: HFXO debounce time. Debounce time = HFXODEBOUNCE * 16 us.

BitField.name: CTIV

Register.name: TRACECONFIG
Register.description: Clocking options for the Trace Port debug interface

BitField.name: TRACEPORTSPEED
BitField.description: Speed of Trace Port clock. Note that the TRACECLK pin will output this clock divided by two.

BitField.name: TRACEMUX
BitField.description: Pin multiplexing of trace signals. See pin assignment chapter for more details.

Enum.name: GPIO
Enum.description: No trace signals routed to pins. All pins can be used as regular GPIOs.

Enum.name: Serial
Enum.description: SWO trace signal routed to pin. Remaining pins can be used as regular GPIOs.

Enum.name: Parallel
Enum.description: All trace signals (TRACECLK and TRACEDATA[n]) routed to pins.

BitField.name: MODE

BitField.name: STATUS

Register.name: TASKS_RSSISTART

Register.name: TASKS_EDSTART
Register.description: Start the Energy Detect measurement used in IEEE 802.15.4 mode

Register.name: TASKS_CCASTART
Register.description: Start the Clear Channel Assessment used in IEEE 802.15.4 mode

Register.name: EVENTS_READY
Register.description: RADIO has ramped up and is ready to be started

Register.name: EVENTS_DEVMATCH
Register.description: A device address match occurred on the last received packet

Register.name: EVENTS_DEVMISS
Register.description: No device address match occurred on the last received packet

Register.name: EVENTS_RSSIEND
Register.description: Sampling of receive signal strength complete.

Register.name: EVENTS_BCMATCH
Register.description: Bit counter reached bit count value.

Register.name: EVENTS_EDEND
Register.description: Sampling of Energy Detection complete. A new ED sample is ready for readout from the RADIO.EDSAMPLE register

Register.name: EVENTS_EDSTOPPED
Register.description: The sampling of Energy Detection has stopped

Register.name: EVENTS_CCAIDLE
Register.description: Wireless medium in idle - clear to send

Register.name: EVENTS_CCABUSY
Register.description: Wireless medium busy - do not send

Register.name: EVENTS_RATEBOOST
Register.description: Ble_LR CI field received, receive mode is changed from Ble_LR125Kbit to Ble_LR500Kbit.

Register.name: EVENTS_TXREADY
Register.description: RADIO has ramped up and is ready to be started TX path

Register.name: EVENTS_RXREADY
Register.description: RADIO has ramped up and is ready to be started RX path

Register.name: EVENTS_PHYEND
Register.description: Generated in Ble_LR125Kbit, Ble_LR500Kbit and BleIeee802154_250Kbit modes when last bit is sent on air.

Register.name: IFTIMING.RXDELAY
Register.description: Sample delay for input serial data on MISO

BitField.name: RXDELAY
BitField.description: Sample delay for input serial data on MISO. The value specifies the number of 64 MHz clock cycles (15.625 ns) delay from the the sampling edge of SCK (leading edge for CONFIG.CPHA = 0, trailing edge for CONFIG.CPHA = 1) until the input serial data is sampled. As en example, if RXDELAY = 0 and CONFIG.CPHA = 0, the input serial data is sampled on the rising edge of SCK.

Register.name: IFTIMING.CSNDUR
Register.description: Minimum duration between edge of CSN and edge of SCK and minimum duration CSN must stay high between transactions

BitField.name: CSNDUR
BitField.description: Minimum duration between edge of CSN and edge of SCK and minimum duration CSN must stay high between transactions. The value is specified in number of 64 MHz clock cycles (15.625 ns).

Register.name: IFTIMING.RXDELAY
Register.description: Sample delay for input serial data on MISO

BitField.name: RXDELAY
BitField.description: Sample delay for input serial data on MISO. The value specifies the number of 64 MHz clock cycles (15.625 ns) delay from the the sampling edge of SCK (leading edge for CONFIG.CPHA = 0, trailing edge for CONFIG.CPHA = 1) until the input serial data is sampled. As en example, if RXDELAY = 0 and CONFIG.CPHA = 0, the input serial data is sampled on the rising edge of SCK.

Register.name: IFTIMING.CSNDUR
Register.description: Minimum duration between edge of CSN and edge of SCK and minimum duration CSN must stay high between transactions

BitField.name: CSNDUR
BitField.description: Minimum duration between edge of CSN and edge of SCK and minimum duration CSN must stay high between transactions. The value is specified in number of 64 MHz clock cycles (15.625 ns).

Register.name: TASKS_ACTIVATE
Register.description: Activate NFCT peripheral for incoming and outgoing frames, change state to activated

Register.name: TASKS_SENSE
Register.description: Enable NFC sense field mode, change state to sense mode

Register.name: TASKS_STARTTX
Register.description: Start transmission of an outgoing frame, change state to transmit

Register.name: TASKS_GOIDLE
Register.description: Force state machine to IDLE state

Register.name: TASKS_GOSLEEP
Register.description: Force state machine to SLEEP_A state

Register.name: EVENTS_READY
Register.description: The NFCT peripheral is ready to receive and send frames

Register.name: EVENTS_TXFRAMESTART
Register.description: Marks the start of the first symbol of a transmitted frame

Register.name: EVENTS_TXFRAMEEND
Register.description: Marks the end of the last transmitted on-air symbol of a frame

Register.name: EVENTS_RXFRAMESTART
Register.description: Marks the end of the first symbol of a received frame

Register.name: EVENTS_RXFRAMEEND
Register.description: Received data has been checked (CRC, parity) and transferred to RAM, and EasyDMA has ended accessing the RX buffer

Register.name: EVENTS_ERROR
Register.description: NFC error reported. The ERRORSTATUS register contains details on the source of the error.

Register.name: EVENTS_RXERROR
Register.description: NFC RX frame error reported. The FRAMESTATUS.RX register contains details on the source of the error.

Register.name: EVENTS_ENDRX
Register.description: RX buffer (as defined by PACKETPTR and MAXLEN) in Data RAM full.

Register.name: EVENTS_ENDTX
Register.description: Transmission of data in RAM has ended, and EasyDMA has ended accessing the TX buffer

Register.name: EVENTS_AUTOCOLRESSTARTED
Register.description: Auto collision resolution process has started

Register.name: EVENTS_COLLISION
Register.description: NFC auto collision resolution error reported.

Register.name: EVENTS_SELECTED
Register.description: NFC auto collision resolution successfully completed

Register.name: EVENTS_STARTED
Register.description: EasyDMA is ready to receive or send frames.

BitField.name: FRAMEDELAYTIMEOUT
BitField.description: No STARTTX task triggered before expiration of the time set in FRAMEDELAYMAX

BitField.name: NFCTAGSTATE
BitField.description: NfcTag state

Register.name: FIELDPRESENT
Register.description: Indicates the presence or not of a valid field

BitField.name: FIELDPRESENT
BitField.description: Indicates if a valid field is present. Available only in the activated state.

BitField.name: LOCKDETECT
BitField.description: Indicates if the low level has locked to the field

BitField.name: FRAMEDELAYMIN
BitField.description: Minimum frame delay in number of 13.56 MHz clocks

BitField.name: FRAMEDELAYMAX
BitField.description: Maximum frame delay in number of 13.56 MHz clocks

Register.name: FRAMEDELAYMODE
Register.description: Configuration register for the Frame Delay Timer

BitField.name: FRAMEDELAYMODE
BitField.description: Configuration register for the Frame Delay Timer

Enum.name: FreeRun
Enum.description: Transmission is independent of frame timer and will start when the STARTTX task is triggered. No timeout.

Enum.name: Window
Enum.description: Frame is transmitted between FRAMEDELAYMIN and FRAMEDELAYMAX

Enum.name: ExactVal
Enum.description: Frame is transmitted exactly at FRAMEDELAYMAX

Enum.name: WindowGrid
Enum.description: Frame is transmitted on a bit grid between FRAMEDELAYMIN and FRAMEDELAYMAX

Register.name: PACKETPTR
Register.description: Packet pointer for TXD and RXD data storage in Data RAM

BitField.name: PTR
BitField.description: Packet pointer for TXD and RXD data storage in Data RAM. This address is a byte-aligned RAM address.

Register.name: MAXLEN
Register.description: Size of the RAM buffer allocated to TXD and RXD data storage each

BitField.name: MAXLEN
BitField.description: Size of the RAM buffer allocated to TXD and RXD data storage each

Register.name: NFCID1_LAST
Register.description: Last NFCID1 part (4, 7 or 10 bytes ID)

BitField.name: NFCID1_Z
BitField.description: NFCID1 byte Z (very last byte sent)

BitField.name: NFCID1_Y
BitField.description: NFCID1 byte Y

BitField.name: NFCID1_X
BitField.description: NFCID1 byte X

BitField.name: NFCID1_W
BitField.description: NFCID1 byte W

Register.name: NFCID1_2ND_LAST
Register.description: Second last NFCID1 part (7 or 10 bytes ID)

BitField.name: NFCID1_V
BitField.description: NFCID1 byte V

BitField.name: NFCID1_U
BitField.description: NFCID1 byte U

BitField.name: NFCID1_T
BitField.description: NFCID1 byte T

Register.name: NFCID1_3RD_LAST
Register.description: Third last NFCID1 part (10 bytes ID)

BitField.name: NFCID1_S
BitField.description: NFCID1 byte S

BitField.name: NFCID1_R
BitField.description: NFCID1 byte R

BitField.name: NFCID1_Q
BitField.description: NFCID1 byte Q

Register.name: AUTOCOLRESCONFIG
Register.description: Controls the auto collision resolution function. This setting must be done before the NFCT peripheral is enabled.

BitField.name: MODE
BitField.description: Enables/disables auto collision resolution

BitField.name: BITFRAMESDD
BitField.description: Bit frame SDD as defined by the b5:b1 of byte 1 in SENS_RES response in the NFC Forum, NFC Digital Protocol Technical Specification

BitField.name: RFU5
BitField.description: Reserved for future use. Shall be 0.

BitField.name: NFCIDSIZE
BitField.description: NFCID1 size. This value is used by the auto collision resolution engine.

BitField.name: PLATFCONFIG
BitField.description: Tag platform configuration as defined by the b4:b1 of byte 2 in SENS_RES response in the NFC Forum, NFC Digital Protocol Technical Specification

BitField.name: RFU74
BitField.description: Reserved for future use. Shall be 0.

BitField.name: RFU10
BitField.description: Reserved for future use. Shall be 0.

BitField.name: CASCADE
BitField.description: Cascade as defined by the b3 of SEL_RES response in the NFC Forum, NFC Digital Protocol Technical Specification (controlled by hardware, shall be 0)

BitField.name: RFU43
BitField.description: Reserved for future use. Shall be 0.

BitField.name: PROTOCOL
BitField.description: Protocol as defined by the b7:b6 of SEL_RES response in the NFC Forum, NFC Digital Protocol Technical Specification

BitField.name: RFU7
BitField.description: Reserved for future use. Shall be 0.

BitField.name: CRCERROR
BitField.description: No valid end of frame (EoF) detected

Enum.name: CRCError
Enum.description: CRC received does not match local check

BitField.name: PARITYSTATUS
BitField.description: Parity status of received frame

BitField.name: OVERRUN
BitField.description: Overrun detected

BitField.name: PARITY
BitField.description: Indicates if parity is added to the frame

Enum.name: NoParity
Enum.description: Parity is not added to TX frames

Enum.name: Parity
Enum.description: Parity is added to TX frames

BitField.name: DISCARDMODE
BitField.description: Discarding unused bits at start or end of a frame

Enum.name: DiscardEnd
Enum.description: Unused bits are discarded at end of frame (EoF)

Enum.name: DiscardStart
Enum.description: Unused bits are discarded at start of frame (SoF)

BitField.name: SOF
BitField.description: Adding SoF or not in TX frames

BitField.name: CRCMODETX
BitField.description: CRC mode for outgoing frames

Enum.name: NoCRCTX
Enum.description: CRC is not added to the frame

Enum.name: CRC16TX
Enum.description: 16 bit CRC added to the frame based on all the data read from RAM that is used in the frame

BitField.name: TXDATABITS
BitField.description: Number of bits in the last or first byte read from RAM that shall be included in the frame (excluding parity bit).

BitField.name: TXDATABYTES
BitField.description: Number of complete bytes that shall be included in the frame, excluding CRC, parity and framing

BitField.name: PARITY
BitField.description: Indicates if parity expected in RX frame

Enum.name: NoParity
Enum.description: Parity is not expected in RX frames

Enum.name: Parity
Enum.description: Parity is expected in RX frames

BitField.name: SOF
BitField.description: SoF expected or not in RX frames

Enum.name: NoSoF
Enum.description: SoF symbol is not expected in RX frames

Enum.name: SoF
Enum.description: SoF symbol is expected in RX frames

BitField.name: CRCMODERX
BitField.description: CRC mode for incoming frames

Enum.name: NoCRCRX
Enum.description: CRC is not expected in RX frames

Enum.name: CRC16RX
Enum.description: Last 16 bits in RX frame is CRC, CRC is checked and CRCSTATUS updated

BitField.name: RXDATABITS
BitField.description: Number of bits in the last byte in the frame, if less than 8 (including CRC, but excluding parity and SoF/EoF framing).

BitField.name: RXDATABYTES
BitField.description: Number of complete bytes received in the frame (including CRC, but excluding parity and SoF/EoF framing)

Register.name: CONFIG[0]
Register.description: Description collection[0]: Configuration for OUT[n], SET[n] and CLR[n] tasks and IN[n] event

Enum.name: Disabled
Enum.description: Disabled. Pin specified by PSEL will not be acquired by the GPIOTE module.

BitField.name: PSEL
BitField.description: GPIO number associated with SET[n], CLR[n] and OUT[n] tasks and IN[n] event

BitField.name: PORT
BitField.description: Port number

BitField.name: POLARITY
BitField.description: When In task mode: Operation to be performed on output when OUT[n] task is triggered. When In event mode: Operation on input that shall trigger IN[n] event.

Enum.name: None
Enum.description: Task mode: No effect on pin from OUT[n] task. Event mode: no IN[n] event generated on pin activity.

Enum.name: LoToHi
Enum.description: Task mode: Set pin from OUT[n] task. Event mode: Generate IN[n] event when rising edge on pin.

Enum.name: HiToLo
Enum.description: Task mode: Clear pin from OUT[n] task. Event mode: Generate IN[n] event when falling edge on pin.

Enum.name: Toggle
Enum.description: Task mode: Toggle pin from OUT[n]. Event mode: Generate IN[n] when any change on pin.

BitField.name: OUTINIT
BitField.description: When in task mode: Initial value of the output when the GPIOTE channel is configured. When in event mode: No effect.

Enum.name: Low
Enum.description: Task mode: Initial value of pin before task triggering is low

Enum.name: High
Enum.description: Task mode: Initial value of pin before task triggering is high

BitField.name: POLARITY
BitField.description: When In task mode: Operation to be performed on output when OUT[n] task is triggered. When In event mode: Operation on input that shall trigger IN[n] event.

Enum.name: None
Enum.description: Task mode: No effect on pin from OUT[n] task. Event mode: no IN[n] event generated on pin activity.

Enum.name: LoToHi
Enum.description: Task mode: Set pin from OUT[n] task. Event mode: Generate IN[n] event when rising edge on pin.

Enum.name: HiToLo
Enum.description: Task mode: Clear pin from OUT[n] task. Event mode: Generate IN[n] event when falling edge on pin.

Enum.name: Toggle
Enum.description: Task mode: Toggle pin from OUT[n]. Event mode: Generate IN[n] when any change on pin.

BitField.name: OUTINIT
BitField.description: When in task mode: Initial value of the output when the GPIOTE channel is configured. When in event mode: No effect.

Enum.name: Low
Enum.description: Task mode: Initial value of pin before task triggering is low

Enum.name: High
Enum.description: Task mode: Initial value of pin before task triggering is high

Register.name: TASKS_START
Register.description: Start the ADC and prepare the result buffer in RAM

Register.name: TASKS_SAMPLE
Register.description: Take one ADC sample, if scan is enabled all channels are sampled

Register.name: TASKS_STOP
Register.description: Stop the ADC and terminate any on-going conversion

Register.name: EVENTS_END
Register.description: The ADC has filled up the Result buffer

Register.name: EVENTS_DONE
Register.description: A conversion task has been completed. Depending on the mode, multiple conversions might be needed for a result to be transferred to RAM.

Register.name: EVENTS_RESULTDONE
Register.description: A result is ready to get transferred to RAM.

Enum.name: Ready
Enum.description: ADC is ready. No on-going conversion.

Enum.name: Busy
Enum.description: ADC is busy. Conversion in progress.

BitField.name: ENABLE
BitField.description: Enable or disable ADC

BitField.name: VAL
BitField.description: Set the resolution

Register.name: OVERSAMPLE
Register.description: Oversampling configuration. OVERSAMPLE should not be combined with SCAN. The RESOLUTION is applied before averaging, thus for high OVERSAMPLE a higher RESOLUTION should be used.

BitField.name: OVERSAMPLE
BitField.description: Oversample control

Register.name: SAMPLERATE
Register.description: Controls normal or continuous sample rate

BitField.name: CC
BitField.description: Capture and compare value. Sample rate is 16 MHz/CC

BitField.name: MODE
BitField.description: Select mode for sample rate control

Enum.name: Task
Enum.description: Rate is controlled from SAMPLE task

Enum.name: Timers
Enum.description: Rate is controlled from local timer (use CC to control the rate)

BitField.description: Negative channel resistor control

BitField.description: Reference control

BitField.description: Acquisition time, the time the ADC uses to sample the input voltage

BitField.description: Enable burst mode

Register.description: Start encryption/decryption. This operation will stop by itself when completed.

Register.description: Override DATARATE setting in MODE register with the contents of the RATEOVERRIDE register for any ongoing encryption/decryption

BitField.description: The result of the MIC check performed during the previous decryption operation

BitField.name: ENABLE
BitField.description: Enable or disable CCM

BitField.name: MODE
BitField.description: The mode of operation to be used. The settings in this register apply whenever either the KSGEN or CRYPT tasks are triggered.

BitField.name: DATARATE
BitField.description: Radio data rate that the CCM shall run synchronous with

BitField.name: LENGTH
BitField.description: Packet length configuration

Enum.name: Default
Enum.description: Default length. Effective length of LENGTH field in encrypted/decrypted packet is 5 bits. A key-stream for packet payloads up to 27 bytes will be generated.

Enum.name: Extended
Enum.description: Extended length. Effective length of LENGTH field in encrypted/decrypted packet is 8 bits. A key-stream for packet payloads up to MAXPACKETSIZE bytes will be generated.

Register.name: CNFPTR
Register.description: Pointer to data structure holding AES key and NONCE vector

BitField.name: CNFPTR
BitField.description: Pointer to the data structure holding the AES key and the CCM NONCE vector (see Table 1 CCM data structure overview)

BitField.name: INPTR
BitField.description: Input pointer

BitField.name: OUTPTR
BitField.description: Output pointer

Register.name: SCRATCHPTR
Register.description: Pointer to data area used for temporary storage

BitField.name: SCRATCHPTR
BitField.description: Pointer to a scratch data area used for temporary storage during key-stream generation, MIC generation and encryption/decryption.

Register.name: MAXPACKETSIZE
Register.description: Length of key-stream generated when MODE.LENGTH = Extended.

BitField.name: MAXPACKETSIZE
BitField.description: Length of key-stream generated when MODE.LENGTH = Extended. This value must be greater or equal to the subsequent packet payload to be encrypted/decrypted.

BitField.name: RATEOVERRIDE
BitField.description: Data rate override setting.

Register.name: TASKS_STOP
Register.description: Stops PWM pulse generation on all channels at the end of current PWM period, and stops sequence playback

Register.name: TASKS_SEQSTART[0]
Register.description: Description collection[0]: Loads the first PWM value on all enabled channels from sequence 0, and starts playing that sequence at the rate defined in SEQ[0]REFRESH and/or DECODER.MODE. Causes PWM generation to start it was not running.

Register.name: TASKS_SEQSTART[1]
Register.description: Description collection[0]: Loads the first PWM value on all enabled channels from sequence 0, and starts playing that sequence at the rate defined in SEQ[0]REFRESH and/or DECODER.MODE. Causes PWM generation to start it was not running.

Register.name: TASKS_NEXTSTEP
Register.description: Steps by one value in the current sequence on all enabled channels if DECODER.MODE=NextStep. Does not cause PWM generation to start it was not running.

Register.name: EVENTS_STOPPED
Register.description: Response to STOP task, emitted when PWM pulses are no longer generated

Register.name: EVENTS_SEQSTARTED[0]
Register.description: Description collection[0]: First PWM period started on sequence 0

Register.name: EVENTS_SEQSTARTED[1]
Register.description: Description collection[0]: First PWM period started on sequence 0

Register.name: EVENTS_SEQEND[0]
Register.description: Description collection[0]: Emitted at end of every sequence 0, when last value from RAM has been applied to wave counter

Register.name: EVENTS_SEQEND[1]
Register.description: Description collection[0]: Emitted at end of every sequence 0, when last value from RAM has been applied to wave counter

Register.name: EVENTS_PWMPERIODEND
Register.description: Emitted at the end of each PWM period

Register.name: EVENTS_LOOPSDONE
Register.description: Concatenated sequences have been played the amount of times defined in LOOP.CNT

BitField.description: Shortcut between LOOPSDONE event and SEQSTART[1] task

BitField.name: LOOPSDONE_STOP
BitField.description: Shortcut between LOOPSDONE event and STOP task

BitField.name: ENABLE
BitField.description: Enable or disable PWM module

Register.name: MODE
Register.description: Selects operating mode of the wave counter

BitField.name: UPDOWN
BitField.description: Selects up or up and down as wave counter mode

Enum.name: Up
Enum.description: Up counter - edge aligned PWM duty-cycle

Enum.name: UpAndDown
Enum.description: Up and down counter - center aligned PWM duty cycle

Register.name: COUNTERTOP
Register.description: Value up to which the pulse generator counter counts

BitField.name: COUNTERTOP
BitField.description: Value up to which the pulse generator counter counts. This register is ignored when DECODER.MODE=WaveForm and only values from RAM will be used.

BitField.name: PRESCALER
BitField.description: Pre-scaler of PWM_CLK

BitField.name: LOAD
BitField.description: How a sequence is read from RAM and spread to the compare register

Enum.name: Common
Enum.description: 1st half word (16-bit) used in all PWM channels 0..3

Enum.name: Grouped
Enum.description: 1st half word (16-bit) used in channel 0..1; 2nd word in channel 2..3

Enum.name: Individual
Enum.description: 1st half word (16-bit) in ch.0; 2nd in ch.1; ...; 4th in ch.3

Enum.name: WaveForm
Enum.description: 1st half word (16-bit) in ch.0; 2nd in ch.1; ...; 4th in COUNTERTOP

BitField.name: MODE
BitField.description: Selects source for advancing the active sequence

Enum.name: RefreshCount
Enum.description: SEQ[n].REFRESH is used to determine loading internal compare registers

Enum.name: NextStep
Enum.description: NEXTSTEP task causes a new value to be loaded to internal compare registers

Register.name: LOOP
Register.description: Amount of playback of a loop

BitField.name: CNT
BitField.description: Amount of playback of pattern cycles

Enum.name: Disabled
Enum.description: Looping disabled (stop at the end of the sequence)

Register.name: SEQ[0].PTR
Register.description: Description cluster[0]: Beginning address in Data RAM of this sequence

BitField.name: PTR
BitField.description: Beginning address in Data RAM of this sequence

Register.name: SEQ[0].CNT
Register.description: Description cluster[0]: Amount of values (duty cycles) in this sequence

BitField.name: CNT
BitField.description: Amount of values (duty cycles) in this sequence

Enum.name: Disabled
Enum.description: Sequence is disabled, and shall not be started as it is empty

Register.name: SEQ[0].REFRESH
Register.description: Description cluster[0]: Amount of additional PWM periods between samples loaded into compare register

BitField.name: CNT
BitField.description: Amount of additional PWM periods between samples loaded into compare register (load every REFRESH.CNT+1 PWM periods)

Register.name: SEQ[0].ENDDELAY
Register.description: Description cluster[0]: Time added after the sequence

BitField.name: CNT
BitField.description: Time added after the sequence in PWM periods

Register.name: SEQ[1].PTR
Register.description: Description cluster[0]: Beginning address in Data RAM of this sequence

BitField.name: PTR
BitField.description: Beginning address in Data RAM of this sequence

Register.name: SEQ[1].CNT
Register.description: Description cluster[0]: Amount of values (duty cycles) in this sequence

BitField.name: CNT
BitField.description: Amount of values (duty cycles) in this sequence

Enum.name: Disabled
Enum.description: Sequence is disabled, and shall not be started as it is empty

Register.name: SEQ[1].REFRESH
Register.description: Description cluster[0]: Amount of additional PWM periods between samples loaded into compare register

BitField.name: CNT
BitField.description: Amount of additional PWM periods between samples loaded into compare register (load every REFRESH.CNT+1 PWM periods)

Register.name: SEQ[1].ENDDELAY
Register.description: Description cluster[0]: Time added after the sequence

BitField.name: CNT
BitField.description: Time added after the sequence in PWM periods

BitField.name: ENABLE
BitField.description: Enable or disable PDM module

BitField.name: FREQ
BitField.description: PDM_CLK frequency

Enum.name: Default
Enum.description: PDM_CLK = 32 MHz / 31 = 1.032 MHz. Nominal clock for RATIO=Ratio64.

Enum.name: 1280K
Enum.description: PDM_CLK = 32 MHz / 25 = 1.280 MHz. Nominal clock for RATIO=Ratio80.

Register.name: MODE
Register.description: Defines the routing of the connected PDM microphones' signals

BitField.name: OPERATION
BitField.description: Mono or stereo operation

Enum.name: Stereo
Enum.description: Sample and store one pair (Left + Right) of 16bit samples per RAM word R=[31:16]; L=[15:0]

Enum.name: Mono
Enum.description: Sample and store two successive Left samples (16 bit each) per RAM word L1=[31:16]; L0=[15:0]

BitField.name: EDGE
BitField.description: Defines on which PDM_CLK edge Left (or mono) is sampled

Enum.name: LeftFalling
Enum.description: Left (or mono) is sampled on falling edge of PDM_CLK

Enum.name: LeftRising
Enum.description: Left (or mono) is sampled on rising edge of PDM_CLK

BitField.name: GAINL
BitField.description: Left output gain adjustment, in 0.5 dB steps, around the default module gain (see electrical parameters) 0x00 -20 dB gain adjust 0x01 -19.5 dB gain adjust (...) 0x27 -0.5 dB gain adjust 0x28 0 dB gain adjust 0x29 +0.5 dB gain adjust (...) 0x4F +19.5 dB gain adjust 0x50 +20 dB gain adjust

BitField.name: GAINR
BitField.description: Right output gain adjustment, in 0.5 dB steps, around the default module gain (see electrical parameters)

Register.name: RATIO
Register.description: Selects the ratio between PDM_CLK and output sample rate. Change PDMCLKCTRL accordingly.

BitField.name: RATIO
BitField.description: Selects the ratio between PDM_CLK and output sample rate

Register.name: PSEL.CLK
Register.description: Pin number configuration for PDM CLK signal

BitField.name: PIN
BitField.description: Pin number

BitField.name: PORT
BitField.description: Port number

Register.name: PSEL.DIN
Register.description: Pin number configuration for PDM DIN signal

BitField.name: PIN
BitField.description: Pin number

BitField.name: PORT
BitField.description: Port number

Register.name: SAMPLE.PTR
Register.description: RAM address pointer to write samples to with EasyDMA

BitField.name: SAMPLEPTR
BitField.description: Address to write PDM samples to over DMA

Register.name: SAMPLE.MAXCNT
Register.description: Number of samples to allocate memory for in EasyDMA mode

BitField.name: BUFFSIZE
BitField.description: Length of DMA RAM allocation in number of samples

BitField.name: READY
BitField.description: NVMC is ready or busy

Enum.name: Busy
Enum.description: NVMC is busy (on-going write or erase operation)

BitField.name: WEN
BitField.description: Program memory access mode. It is strongly recommended to only activate erase and write modes when they are actively used. Enabling write or erase will invalidate the cache and keep it invalidated.

Register.name: ERASEPAGE
Register.description: Register for erasing a page in code area

BitField.name: ERASEPAGE
BitField.description: Register for starting erase of a page in code area

Register.name: ERASEPCR1
Register.description: Deprecated register - Register for erasing a page in code area. Equivalent to ERASEPAGE.

BitField.name: ERASEPCR1
BitField.description: Register for erasing a page in code area. Equivalent to ERASEPAGE.

Register.name: ERASEALL
Register.description: Register for erasing all non-volatile user memory

BitField.name: ERASEALL
BitField.description: Erase all non-volatile memory including UICR registers. Note that the erase must be enabled using CONFIG.WEN before the non-volatile memory can be erased.

Register.name: ERASEPCR0
Register.description: Deprecated register - Register for erasing a page in code area. Equivalent to ERASEPAGE.

BitField.name: ERASEPCR0
BitField.description: Register for starting erase of a page in code area. Equivalent to ERASEPAGE.

Register.name: ERASEUICR
Register.description: Register for erasing user information configuration registers

BitField.name: ERASEUICR
BitField.description: Register starting erase of all user information configuration registers. Note that the erase must be enabled using CONFIG.WEN before the UICR can be erased.

BitField.name: CACHEEN
BitField.description: Cache enable

Enum.name: Disabled
Enum.description: Disable cache. Invalidates all cache entries.

BitField.name: CACHEPROFEN
BitField.description: Cache profiling enable

BitField.name: HITS
BitField.description: Number of cache hits

BitField.name: MISSES
BitField.description: Number of cache misses

Register.name: ADDR
Register.description: Description cluster[0]: Configure the word-aligned start address of region 0 to protect

BitField.name: ADDR
BitField.description: Valid word-aligned start address of region 0 to protect. Address must point to a flash page boundary.

Register.name: SIZE
Register.description: Description cluster[0]: Size of region to protect counting from address ACL[0].ADDR. Write '0' as no effect.

BitField.name: SIZE
BitField.description: Size of flash region 0 in bytes. Must be a multiple of the flash page size.

Register.name: PERM
Register.description: Description cluster[0]: Access permissions for region 0 as defined by start address ACL[0].ADDR and size ACL[0].SIZE

BitField.name: WRITE
BitField.description: Configure write and erase permissions for region 0. Write '0' has no effect.

Enum.name: Enable
Enum.description: Allow write and erase instructions to region 0

Enum.name: Disable
Enum.description: Block write and erase instructions to region 0

BitField.name: READ
BitField.description: Configure read permissions for region 0. Write '0' has no effect.

Register.name: TASKS_STOP
Register.description: Stops PWM pulse generation on all channels at the end of current PWM period, and stops sequence playback

Register.name: TASKS_SEQSTART[0]
Register.description: Description collection[0]: Loads the first PWM value on all enabled channels from sequence 0, and starts playing that sequence at the rate defined in SEQ[0]REFRESH and/or DECODER.MODE. Causes PWM generation to start it was not running.

Register.name: TASKS_SEQSTART[1]
Register.description: Description collection[0]: Loads the first PWM value on all enabled channels from sequence 0, and starts playing that sequence at the rate defined in SEQ[0]REFRESH and/or DECODER.MODE. Causes PWM generation to start it was not running.

Register.name: TASKS_NEXTSTEP
Register.description: Steps by one value in the current sequence on all enabled channels if DECODER.MODE=NextStep. Does not cause PWM generation to start it was not running.

Register.name: EVENTS_STOPPED
Register.description: Response to STOP task, emitted when PWM pulses are no longer generated

Register.name: EVENTS_SEQSTARTED[0]
Register.description: Description collection[0]: First PWM period started on sequence 0

Register.name: EVENTS_SEQSTARTED[1]
Register.description: Description collection[0]: First PWM period started on sequence 0

Register.name: EVENTS_SEQEND[0]
Register.description: Description collection[0]: Emitted at end of every sequence 0, when last value from RAM has been applied to wave counter

Register.name: EVENTS_SEQEND[1]
Register.description: Description collection[0]: Emitted at end of every sequence 0, when last value from RAM has been applied to wave counter

Register.name: EVENTS_PWMPERIODEND
Register.description: Emitted at the end of each PWM period

Register.name: EVENTS_LOOPSDONE
Register.description: Concatenated sequences have been played the amount of times defined in LOOP.CNT

BitField.name: SEQEND0_STOP
BitField.description: Shortcut between SEQEND[0] event and STOP task

BitField.name: SEQEND1_STOP
BitField.description: Shortcut between SEQEND[1] event and STOP task

BitField.name: LOOPSDONE_SEQSTART0
BitField.description: Shortcut between LOOPSDONE event and SEQSTART[0] task

BitField.name: LOOPSDONE_SEQSTART1
BitField.description: Shortcut between LOOPSDONE event and SEQSTART[1] task

BitField.name: LOOPSDONE_STOP
BitField.description: Shortcut between LOOPSDONE event and STOP task

BitField.name: STOPPED
BitField.description: Enable or disable interrupt for STOPPED event

BitField.name: SEQSTARTED0
BitField.description: Enable or disable interrupt for SEQSTARTED[0] event

BitField.name: SEQSTARTED1
BitField.description: Enable or disable interrupt for SEQSTARTED[1] event

BitField.name: SEQEND0
BitField.description: Enable or disable interrupt for SEQEND[0] event

BitField.name: SEQEND1
BitField.description: Enable or disable interrupt for SEQEND[1] event

BitField.name: PWMPERIODEND
BitField.description: Enable or disable interrupt for PWMPERIODEND event

BitField.name: LOOPSDONE
BitField.description: Enable or disable interrupt for LOOPSDONE event

BitField.name: STOPPED
BitField.description: Write '1' to Enable interrupt for STOPPED event

BitField.name: SEQSTARTED0
BitField.description: Write '1' to Enable interrupt for SEQSTARTED[0] event

BitField.name: SEQSTARTED1
BitField.description: Write '1' to Enable interrupt for SEQSTARTED[1] event

BitField.name: SEQEND0
BitField.description: Write '1' to Enable interrupt for SEQEND[0] event

BitField.name: PWMPERIODEND

BitField.name: LOOPSDONE
BitField.description: Write '1' to Enable interrupt for LOOPSDONE event

BitField.description: Write '1' to Disable interrupt for STOPPED event

BitField.description: Write '1' to Disable interrupt for SEQSTARTED[0] event

Register.name: TASKS_STOP
Register.description: Stops PWM pulse generation on all channels at the end of current PWM period, and stops sequence playback

Register.name: TASKS_SEQSTART[0]
Register.description: Description collection[0]: Loads the first PWM value on all enabled channels from sequence 0, and starts playing that sequence at the rate defined in SEQ[0]REFRESH and/or DECODER.MODE. Causes PWM generation to start it was not running.

Register.name: TASKS_SEQSTART[1]
Register.description: Description collection[0]: Loads the first PWM value on all enabled channels from sequence 0, and starts playing that sequence at the rate defined in SEQ[0]REFRESH and/or DECODER.MODE. Causes PWM generation to start it was not running.

Register.name: TASKS_NEXTSTEP
Register.description: Steps by one value in the current sequence on all enabled channels if DECODER.MODE=NextStep. Does not cause PWM generation to start it was not running.

Register.name: EVENTS_STOPPED
Register.description: Response to STOP task, emitted when PWM pulses are no longer generated

Register.name: EVENTS_SEQSTARTED[0]
Register.description: Description collection[0]: First PWM period started on sequence 0

Register.name: EVENTS_SEQSTARTED[1]
Register.description: Description collection[0]: First PWM period started on sequence 0

Register.name: EVENTS_SEQEND[0]
Register.description: Description collection[0]: Emitted at end of every sequence 0, when last value from RAM has been applied to wave counter

Register.name: EVENTS_SEQEND[1]
Register.description: Description collection[0]: Emitted at end of every sequence 0, when last value from RAM has been applied to wave counter

Register.name: EVENTS_PWMPERIODEND
Register.description: Emitted at the end of each PWM period

Register.name: EVENTS_LOOPSDONE
Register.description: Concatenated sequences have been played the amount of times defined in LOOP.CNT

Register.name: IFTIMING.RXDELAY
Register.description: Sample delay for input serial data on MISO

BitField.name: RXDELAY
BitField.description: Sample delay for input serial data on MISO. The value specifies the number of 64 MHz clock cycles (15.625 ns) delay from the the sampling edge of SCK (leading edge for CONFIG.CPHA = 0, trailing edge for CONFIG.CPHA = 1) until the input serial data is sampled. As en example, if RXDELAY = 0 and CONFIG.CPHA = 0, the input serial data is sampled on the rising edge of SCK.

Register.name: IFTIMING.CSNDUR
Register.description: Minimum duration between edge of CSN and edge of SCK and minimum duration CSN must stay high between transactions

BitField.name: CSNDUR
BitField.description: Minimum duration between edge of CSN and edge of SCK and minimum duration CSN must stay high between transactions. The value is specified in number of 64 MHz clock cycles (15.625 ns).

Register.description: 12 bit prescaler for COUNTER frequency (32768/(PRESCALER+1)).Must be written when RTC is stopped

BitField.name: PRESCALER
BitField.description: Prescaler value

BitField.name: COMPARE
BitField.description: Compare value

BitField.name: COMPARE
BitField.description: Compare value

BitField.name: COMPARE
BitField.description: Compare value

BitField.name: COMPARE
BitField.description: Compare value

Register.name: TASKS_START
Register.description: Starts continuous I2S transfer. Also starts MCK generator when this is enabled.

Register.name: TASKS_STOP
Register.description: Stops I2S transfer. Also stops MCK generator. Triggering this task will cause the {event:STOPPED} event to be generated.

Register.name: EVENTS_RXPTRUPD
Register.description: The RXD.PTR register has been copied to internal double-buffers. When the I2S module is started and RX is enabled, this event will be generated for every RXTXD.MAXCNT words that are received on the SDIN pin.

Register.name: EVENTS_TXPTRUPD
Register.description: The TDX.PTR register has been copied to internal double-buffers. When the I2S module is started and TX is enabled, this event will be generated for every RXTXD.MAXCNT words that are sent on the SDOUT pin.

BitField.name: RXPTRUPD
BitField.description: Enable or disable interrupt for RXPTRUPD event

BitField.name: STOPPED
BitField.description: Enable or disable interrupt for STOPPED event

BitField.name: TXPTRUPD
BitField.description: Enable or disable interrupt for TXPTRUPD event

BitField.name: RXPTRUPD
BitField.description: Write '1' to Enable interrupt for RXPTRUPD event

BitField.name: STOPPED
BitField.description: Write '1' to Enable interrupt for STOPPED event

BitField.name: TXPTRUPD
BitField.description: Write '1' to Enable interrupt for TXPTRUPD event

BitField.name: RXPTRUPD
BitField.description: Write '1' to Disable interrupt for RXPTRUPD event

BitField.name: STOPPED
BitField.description: Write '1' to Disable interrupt for STOPPED event

BitField.name: TXPTRUPD
BitField.description: Write '1' to Disable interrupt for TXPTRUPD event

BitField.name: ENABLE
BitField.description: Enable I2S module.

BitField.name: MODE
BitField.description: I2S mode.

Enum.name: Master
Enum.description: Master mode. SCK and LRCK generated from internal master clcok (MCK) and output on pins defined by PSEL.xxx.

Enum.name: Slave
Enum.description: Slave mode. SCK and LRCK generated by external master and received on pins defined by PSEL.xxx

BitField.name: RXEN
BitField.description: Reception (RX) enable.

Enum.name: Disabled
Enum.description: Reception disabled and now data will be written to the RXD.PTR address.

BitField.name: TXEN
BitField.description: Transmission (TX) enable.

Enum.name: Disabled
Enum.description: Transmission disabled and now data will be read from the RXD.TXD address.

BitField.name: MCKEN
BitField.description: Master clock generator enable.

Enum.name: Disabled
Enum.description: Master clock generator disabled and PSEL.MCK not connected(available as GPIO).

Enum.name: Enabled
Enum.description: Master clock generator running and MCK output on PSEL.MCK.

BitField.name: MCKFREQ
BitField.description: Master clock generator frequency.

BitField.name: RATIO
BitField.description: MCK / LRCK ratio.

BitField.name: SWIDTH
BitField.description: Sample width.

Register.name: CONFIG.ALIGN
Register.description: Alignment of sample within a frame.

BitField.name: ALIGN
BitField.description: Alignment of sample within a frame.

BitField.name: FORMAT
BitField.description: Frame format.

BitField.name: CHANNELS
BitField.description: Enable channels.

BitField.name: PTR
BitField.description: Receive buffer Data RAM start address. When receiving, words containing samples will be written to this address. This address is a word aligned Data RAM address.

BitField.name: PTR
BitField.description: Transmit buffer Data RAM start address. When transmitting, words containing samples will be fetched from this address. This address is a word aligned Data RAM address.

Register.name: RXTXD.MAXCNT
Register.description: Size of RXD and TXD buffers.

BitField.name: MAXCNT
BitField.description: Size of RXD and TXD buffers in number of 32 bit words.

BitField.name: PIN
BitField.description: Pin number

BitField.name: PORT
BitField.description: Port number

BitField.description: Pin number

BitField.description: Port number

Register.name: TASKS_STARTEPOUT[0]

Register.description: Description collection[0]: Captures the EPOUT[0].PTR, EPOUT[0].MAXCNT and EPOUT[0].CONFIG registers values, and enables endpoint 0 to respond to traffic from host

Register.description: Description collection[0]: Captures the EPOUT[0].PTR, EPOUT[0].MAXCNT and EPOUT[0].CONFIG registers values, and enables endpoint 0 to respond to traffic from host

Register.description: Description collection[0]: Captures the EPOUT[0].PTR, EPOUT[0].MAXCNT and EPOUT[0].CONFIG registers values, and enables endpoint 0 to respond to traffic from host

Register.description: Description collection[0]: Captures the EPOUT[0].PTR, EPOUT[0].MAXCNT and EPOUT[0].CONFIG registers values, and enables endpoint 0 to respond to traffic from host

Register.description: Description collection[0]: Captures the EPOUT[0].PTR, EPOUT[0].MAXCNT and EPOUT[0].CONFIG registers values, and enables endpoint 0 to respond to traffic from host

Register.description: Description collection[0]: Captures the EPOUT[0].PTR, EPOUT[0].MAXCNT and EPOUT[0].CONFIG registers values, and enables endpoint 0 to respond to traffic from host

Register.name: TASKS_STARTISOOUT
Register.description: Captures the ISOOUT.PTR, ISOOUT.MAXCNT and ISOOUT.CONFIG registers values, and enables receiving of data on iso endpoint

Register.name: TASKS_EP0RCVOUT
Register.description: Allows OUT data stage on control endpoint 0

Register.name: TASKS_EP0STATUS
Register.description: Allows status stage on control endpoint 0

Register.name: TASKS_EP0STALL
Register.description: STALLs data and status stage on control endpoint 0

Register.name: TASKS_DPDMDRIVE
Register.description: Forces D+ and D-lines to the state defined in the DPDMVALUE register

Register.name: TASKS_DPDMNODRIVE
Register.description: Stops forcing D+ and D- lines to any state (USB engine takes control)

Register.name: EVENTS_USBRESET
Register.description: Signals that a USB reset condition has been detected on the USB lines

Register.name: EVENTS_STARTED
Register.description: Confirms that the EPIN[n].PTR, EPIN[n].MAXCNT, EPIN[n].CONFIG, or EPOUT[n].PTR, EPOUT[n].MAXCNT and EPOUT[n].CONFIG registers have been captured on all endpoints reported in the EPSTATUS register

Register.name: EVENTS_USBEVENT
Register.description: An event or an error not covered by specific events has occurred, check EVENTCAUSE register to find the cause

Register.name: EVENTS_EP0SETUP
Register.description: A valid SETUP token has been received (and acknowledged) on the control endpoint

Register.name: EVENTS_EPDATA
Register.description: A data transfer has occurred on a data endpoint, indicated by the EPDATASTATUS register

Register.name: EVENTS_ACCESSFAULT
Register.description: Access to an unavailable USB register has been attempted (software or EasyDMA). This event can get fired even when USBD is not ENABLEd.

BitField.description: Write '1' to Disable interrupt for READY event

BitField.description: Enable or disable QSPI

Register.name: XIPOFFSET
Register.description: Address offset into the external memory for Execute in Place operation.

BitField.name: XIPOFFSET
BitField.description: Address offset into the external memory for Execute in Place operation. Value must be a multiple of 4.

BitField.name: READOC
BitField.description: Configure number of data lines and opcode used for reading.

BitField.name: WRITEOC
BitField.description: Configure number of data lines and opcode used for writing.

BitField.name: ADDRMODE
BitField.description: Addressing mode.

BitField.name: DPMENABLE
BitField.description: Enable deep power-down mode (DPM) feature.

BitField.name: PPSIZE
BitField.description: Page size for commands PP, PP2O, PP4O and PP4IO.

BitField.name: SCKDELAY
BitField.description: Minimum amount of time that the CSN pin must stay high before it can go low again. Value is specified in number of 16 MHz periods (62.5 ns).

BitField.name: DPMEN
BitField.description: Enter/exit deep power-down mode (DPM) for external flash memory.

BitField.name: SPIMODE
BitField.description: Select SPI mode.

Enum.name: MODE0
Enum.description: Mode 0: Data are captured on the clock rising edge and data is output on a falling edge. Base level of clock is 0 (CPOL=0, CPHA=0).

Enum.name: MODE3
Enum.description: Mode 3: Data are captured on the clock falling edge and data is output on a rising edge. Base level of clock is 1 (CPOL=1, CPHA=1).

BitField.name: SCKFREQ
BitField.description: SCK frequency is given as 32 MHz / (SCKFREQ + 1).

BitField.name: DPM
BitField.description: Deep power-down mode (DPM) status of external flash.

Enum.name: Disabled
Enum.description: External flash is not in DPM.

BitField.name: READY
BitField.description: Ready status.

Enum.name: READY
Enum.description: QSPI peripheral is ready. It is allowed to trigger new tasks, writing custom instructions or enter/exit DPM.

Enum.name: BUSY
Enum.description: QSPI peripheral is busy. It is not allowed to trigger any new tasks, writing custom instructions or enter/exit DPM.

BitField.name: SREG
BitField.description: Value of external flash device Status Register. When the external flash has two bytes status register this field includes the value of the low byte.

Register.name: DPMDUR
Register.description: Set the duration required to enter/exit deep power-down mode (DPM).

BitField.name: ENTER
BitField.description: Duration needed by external flash to enter DPM. Duration is given as ENTER * 256 * 62.5 ns.

BitField.name: EXIT
BitField.description: Duration needed by external flash to exit DPM. Duration is given as EXIT * 256 * 62.5 ns.

BitField.name: OPCODE
BitField.description: Opcode that enters the 32-bit addressing mode.

BitField.name: BYTE0
BitField.description: Byte 0 following opcode.

BitField.name: BYTE1
BitField.description: Byte 1 following byte 0.

BitField.name: MODE
BitField.description: Extended addressing mode.

BitField.name: WIPWAIT
BitField.description: Wait for write complete before sending command.

BitField.name: WREN
BitField.description: Send WREN (write enable opcode 0x06) before instruction.

BitField.name: OPCODE
BitField.description: Opcode of Custom instruction.

BitField.name: LENGTH
BitField.description: Length of custom instruction in number of bytes.

BitField.name: LIO2
BitField.description: Level of the IO2 pin (if connected) during transmission of custom instruction.

BitField.name: LIO3
BitField.description: Level of the IO3 pin (if connected) during transmission of custom instruction.

BitField.name: WIPWAIT
BitField.description: Wait for write complete before sending command.

BitField.name: WREN
BitField.description: Send WREN (write enable opcode 0x06) before instruction.

BitField.name: LFEN
BitField.description: Enable long frame mode. When enabled, a custom instruction transaction has to be ended by writing the LFSTOP field.

BitField.description: Stop (finalize) long frame transaction

BitField.name: RXDELAY
BitField.description: Timing related to sampling of the input serial data. The value of RXDELAY specifies the number of 64 MHz cycles (15.625 ns) delay from the the rising edge of the SPI Clock (SCK) until the input serial data is sampled. As en example, if set to 0 the input serial data is sampled on the rising edge of SCK.

Register.name: TASKS_STOP
Register.description: Stops PWM pulse generation on all channels at the end of current PWM period, and stops sequence playback

Register.name: TASKS_SEQSTART[0]
Register.description: Description collection[0]: Loads the first PWM value on all enabled channels from sequence 0, and starts playing that sequence at the rate defined in SEQ[0]REFRESH and/or DECODER.MODE. Causes PWM generation to start it was not running.

Register.name: TASKS_SEQSTART[1]
Register.description: Description collection[0]: Loads the first PWM value on all enabled channels from sequence 0, and starts playing that sequence at the rate defined in SEQ[0]REFRESH and/or DECODER.MODE. Causes PWM generation to start it was not running.

Register.name: TASKS_NEXTSTEP
Register.description: Steps by one value in the current sequence on all enabled channels if DECODER.MODE=NextStep. Does not cause PWM generation to start it was not running.

Register.name: EVENTS_STOPPED
Register.description: Response to STOP task, emitted when PWM pulses are no longer generated

Register.name: EVENTS_SEQSTARTED[0]
Register.description: Description collection[0]: First PWM period started on sequence 0

Register.name: EVENTS_SEQSTARTED[1]
Register.description: Description collection[0]: First PWM period started on sequence 0

Register.name: EVENTS_SEQEND[0]
Register.description: Description collection[0]: Emitted at end of every sequence 0, when last value from RAM has been applied to wave counter

Register.name: EVENTS_SEQEND[1]
Register.description: Description collection[0]: Emitted at end of every sequence 0, when last value from RAM has been applied to wave counter

Register.name: EVENTS_PWMPERIODEND
Register.description: Emitted at the end of each PWM period

Register.name: EVENTS_LOOPSDONE
Register.description: Concatenated sequences have been played the amount of times defined in LOOP.CNT

Enum.name: Common

Enum.name: Individual
Enum.description: 1st half word (16-bit) in ch.0; 2nd in ch.1; ...; 4th in ch.3

Enum.name: WaveForm
Enum.description: 1st half word (16-bit) in ch.0; 2nd in ch.1; ...; 4th in COUNTERTOP

Register.name: IFTIMING.RXDELAY
Register.description: Sample delay for input serial data on MISO

BitField.name: RXDELAY
BitField.description: Sample delay for input serial data on MISO. The value specifies the number of 64 MHz clock cycles (15.625 ns) delay from the the sampling edge of SCK (leading edge for CONFIG.CPHA = 0, trailing edge for CONFIG.CPHA = 1) until the input serial data is sampled. As en example, if RXDELAY = 0 and CONFIG.CPHA = 0, the input serial data is sampled on the rising edge of SCK.

Register.name: IFTIMING.CSNDUR
Register.description: Minimum duration between edge of CSN and edge of SCK and minimum duration CSN must stay high between transactions

BitField.name: CSNDUR
BitField.description: Minimum duration between edge of CSN and edge of SCK and minimum duration CSN must stay high between transactions. The value is specified in number of 64 MHz clock cycles (15.625 ns).

Enum.description: Configure pin as an output pin

Enum.description: Standard '0'. disconnect '1' (normally used for wired-and connections)

Enum.name: H0D1
Enum.description: High drive '0', disconnect '1' (normally used for wired-and connections)

BitField.description: Select between default DETECT signal behaviour and LDETECT mode

Enum.name: Default
Enum.description: DETECT directly connected to PIN DETECT signals

Register.name: PIN_CNF[0]
Register.description: Description collection[0]: Configuration of GPIO pins

BitField.name: DIR
BitField.description: Pin direction. Same physical register as DIR register

Enum.name: Input
Enum.description: Configure pin as an input pin

Enum.name: Output
Enum.description: Configure pin as an output pin

BitField.name: INPUT
BitField.description: Connect or disconnect input buffer

BitField.name: PULL
BitField.description: Pull configuration

BitField.name: DRIVE
BitField.description: Drive configuration

Enum.name: D0S1
Enum.description: Disconnect '0' standard '1' (normally used for wired-or connections)

Enum.name: D0H1
Enum.description: Disconnect '0', high drive '1' (normally used for wired-or connections)

Enum.name: S0D1
Enum.description: Standard '0'. disconnect '1' (normally used for wired-and connections)

Enum.name: H0D1
Enum.description: High drive '0', disconnect '1' (normally used for wired-and connections)

BitField.description: Pin sensing mechanism

Register.name: ENABLE
Register.description: Control power and clock for ARM CryptoCell subsystem

BitField.name: ENABLE
BitField.description: Enable or disable the CryptoCell subsystem

BitField.name: COUNTFLAG
BitField.description: Counter Flag

BitField.name: CLKSOURCE
BitField.description: Timer Clock Source

BitField.name: TICKINT
BitField.description: Tick Interrupt Enable

BitField.name: ENABLE
BitField.description: Enable SysTick Timer

BitField.name: RELOAD
BitField.description: Value to load into the SYST_CVR when the counter is enabled and when it reaches 0

BitField.name: CURRENT
BitField.description: The current value of the SysTick counter

BitField.name: NOREF
BitField.description: Indicates whether the device provides a reference clock to the processor

BitField.name: SKEW
BitField.description: Indicates whether the TENMS value is exact

BitField.name: TENMS
BitField.description: Reload value for 10ms (100Hz) timing, subject to system clock skew errors

BitField.name: DISOOFP
BitField.description: Disables floating pointinstructions completing outof order with respect to integer instructions

BitField.name: DISFPCA
BitField.description: When set to 1, disables IT folding

BitField.name: DISFOLD
BitField.description: When set to 1, disables write buffer use during default memory map accesses

BitField.name: DISDEFWBUF
BitField.description: When set to 1, disables write buffer use during default memory map accesses

BitField.name: DISMCYCINT
BitField.description: When set to 1, disables interruption of load multiple and store multiple instructions

BitField.name: IMPLEMENTER
BitField.description: Implementer Code

BitField.name: VARIANT
BitField.description: Variant Number

BitField.name: PARTNO
BitField.description: Part Number

BitField.name: REVISION
BitField.description: Revision Number

BitField.name: NMIPENDSET
BitField.description: NMI set-pending bit

BitField.name: PENDSVSET
BitField.description: PendSV set-pending bit

BitField.name: PENDSVCLR
BitField.description: PendSV clear-pending bit

BitField.name: PENDSTSET
BitField.description: SysTick exception set-pending bit

BitField.name: PENDSTCLR
BitField.description: SysTick exception clear-pending bit

BitField.name: ISRPENDING
BitField.description: Interrupt pending flag

BitField.name: VECTPENDING
BitField.description: Indicates the exception number of the highest priority pending enabled exception

BitField.name: RETTOBASE
BitField.description: Indicates whether there are preempted active exceptions

BitField.name: VECTACTIVE
BitField.description: Contains the active exception number

BitField.name: TBLOFF
BitField.description: Vector table base offset field

Register.name: AIRCR
Register.description: Application Interrupt and Reset Control Register

BitField.name: VECTKEY
BitField.description: Register key

BitField.name: ENDIANESS
BitField.description: Data endianness bit

BitField.name: PRIGROUP
BitField.description: Interrupt priority grouping field

BitField.name: SYSRESETREQ
BitField.description: System reset request bit

BitField.name: SEVONPEND
BitField.description: Send event on pending bit

BitField.name: SLEEPDEEP
BitField.description: Controls whether the processor uses sleep or deep sleep as its low power mode

BitField.name: SLEEPONEXIT
BitField.description: Indicates sleep-on-exit when returning from Handler mode to Thread mode

BitField.name: STKALIGN
BitField.description: Indicates stack alignment on exception entry

BitField.name: BFHFNMIGN
BitField.description: Enables handlers with priority -1 or-2 to ignore data BusFaults caused by load and store instructions

BitField.name: DIV_0_TRP
BitField.description: Enables faulting or halting when the processor executes an SDIVor UDIV instruction with a divisor of 0

BitField.name: UNALIGN_TRP
BitField.description: Enables unaligned access traps

BitField.name: USERSETMPEND
BitField.description: Enables unprivileged software access to the STIR

BitField.name: NONBASETHRDENA
BitField.description: Indicates how the processor enters Thread mode

BitField.name: PRI_6
BitField.description: Priority of system handler 6 (UsageFault)

BitField.name: PRI_5
BitField.description: Priority of system handler 5 (BusFault)

BitField.name: PRI_4
BitField.description: Priority of system handler 4 (MemManage)

BitField.name: PRI_11
BitField.description: Priority of system handler 11 (SVCall)

BitField.name: PRI_15
BitField.description: Priority of system handler 15 (SysTick)

BitField.name: PRI_14
BitField.description: Priority of system handler 14 (PendSV)

Register.name: SHCSR
Register.description: System Handler Control and State Register

BitField.name: USGFAULTENA
BitField.description: UsageFault enable Bit

BitField.name: BUSFAULTENA
BitField.description: BusFault Enable Bit

BitField.name: MEMFAULTENA
BitField.description: MemManage Enable Bit

BitField.description: BusFault Exception Active Bit

BitField.name: MMARVALID
BitField.description: MemManage Fault Address Register(MMFAR) valid flag

BitField.name: MLSPERR
BitField.description: Indicates a MemManage fault occurred during floating-point lazy state preservation

BitField.name: MSTKERR
BitField.description: MemManage fault on stacking for exception entry

BitField.name: MUNSTKERR
BitField.description: MemManage fault on unstacking for a return from exception

BitField.name: DACCVIOL
BitField.description: Data access violation flag

BitField.name: IACCVIOL
BitField.description: Instruction access violation flag

BitField.name: BFARVALID
BitField.description: BusFault Address Register(BFAR) valid flag

BitField.name: LSPERR
BitField.description: Indicates a bus fault occurred during floating-point lazy state preservation

BitField.name: STKERR
BitField.description: BusFault on stacking for exception entry

BitField.name: UNSTKERR
BitField.description: BusFault on unstacking for a return from exception

BitField.name: IMPRECISERR
BitField.description: Imprecise data bus error

BitField.name: PRECISERR
BitField.description: Precise data bus error

BitField.name: IBUSERR
BitField.description: Instruction bus error

BitField.name: DIVBYZERO
BitField.description: Divide by zero UsageFault

BitField.name: UNALIGNED
BitField.description: Unaligned access UsageFault

BitField.name: NOCP
BitField.description: No coprocessor UsageFault

BitField.name: INVPC
BitField.description: Invalid PC load UsageFault, causedby an invalid PC load by EXC_RETURN

BitField.name: INVSTATE
BitField.description: Invalid state UsageFault

BitField.name: UNDEFINSTR
BitField.description: Undefined instruction UsageFault

BitField.name: FORCED
BitField.description: Indicates a forced hard fault, generated by escalation of a fault with configurable priority that cannot be handled, either because of priority or because it is disabled

BitField.name: VECTTBL
BitField.description: Indicates a BusFault on a vectortable read during exception processing

BitField.name: ADDRESS
BitField.description: When the MMARVALID bit of the MMFSR is set to 1, this field holds the address of the location that generated the MemManage fault

BitField.name: ADDRESS
BitField.description: When the BFARVALID bit of the BFSR is set to1, this field holds the address of the location that generated the BusFault

BitField.name: IMPDEF
BitField.description: Implementation defined, the bits map to the AUXFAULT input signals

BitField.name: IREGION
BitField.description: Number of supported MPU instruction regions

BitField.name: DREGION
BitField.description: Number of supported MPU data regions

BitField.name: SEPARATE
BitField.description: Support for unified or separate instruction and date memory maps

BitField.name: PRIVDEFENA
BitField.description: Enables privileged software access to the default memory map

BitField.name: HFNMIENA
BitField.description: Enable the operation of MPU during hard fault, NMI, and FAULTMASK handlers

BitField.name: ENABLE
BitField.description: Enable MPU

BitField.name: REGION
BitField.description: Indicates the MPU region referenced by the MPU_RBAR and MPU_RASR registers

BitField.name: ADDR
BitField.description: Region base address field

BitField.name: VALID
BitField.description: MPU Region Number valid bit

BitField.name: REGION
BitField.description: MPU region field

Register.name: MPU_RASR
Register.description: MPU Region Attribute and Size Register

BitField.name: XN
BitField.description: Instruction access disable bit

BitField.name: AP
BitField.description: Access permission field

BitField.name: TEX
BitField.description: Memory access attribute

BitField.name: S
BitField.description: Shareable bit

BitField.name: C
BitField.description: Memory access attribute

BitField.name: B
BitField.description: Memory access attribute

BitField.name: SRD
BitField.description: Subregion disable bits

BitField.name: SIZE
BitField.description: MPU protection region size
